definition: to ascertain/to act on/to criticize/to pass on/classifier for batches, lots, military flights/tier (for the ranking of universities and colleges)
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)
to reply officially to a subordinate
to write comments on a report submitted by a subordinate/written comments from a superior
to do sth in batches or groups
to report for criticism/to submit for approval to higher authority
official written ruling in response to a submission/official approval in writing

sentences.english: The warrant once granted, your will of course directed everything.
sentences.chinese: 逮捕令一旦批了下來，你的意志當然就主宰一切了。

sentences.english: The proposed repeat of the corporate tax repatriation holiday is one such wolf in sheep's clothing.
sentences.chinese: 重提回流資金減稅就是這種批着羊皮的狼。

sentences.english: Did you log on PTT today?
We have to send in the plan for approval.
sentences.chinese: 這計劃我們得送上去批。

sentences.english: The employment of a lot number from which the complete batch history can be determined.
sentences.chinese: 批號的使用，倨其完整的批歷史可以確定。

sentences.english: The mayor did not look at him, but went on annotating this docket .
sentences.chinese: 市長先生不望他，仍舊批他的公事。

sentences.english: We have ice cream and apple pie, would you like some?
sentences.chinese: 我們提供雪糕和蘋果批，你們要些嗎？

sentences.english: The plans were set in motion when the company president signed the document.
sentences.chinese: 當公司董事長批下公文時，這計劃便開始作業了。

sentences.english: I bought a bit of baking powder and baked a batch of biscuits.
sentences.chinese: 我買了位發酵粉並且烘烤了批餅乾。

sentences.english: The quality of patents issued in China is also improving.
sentences.chinese: 批給中國公司的專利水平也在快速增加。

sentences.english: The president's new policy was taken to pieces by the opposite.
sentences.chinese: 反對派把總統的新政策批得體無完膚。

sentences.english: The new editor picked her manuscript to pieces.
sentences.chinese: 新編輯把她的原稿批得一無是處。

sentences.english: The Japanese later senttoo2 more gifts of cherry trees.
sentences.chinese: 之後，日本又送來2批櫻花樹作爲禮物。

sentences.english: If you start your first Kombucha batch, add the liquid that came with the culture.
sentences.chinese: 如果你開始你的第一次康普茶培養批，加入液體培養。

sentences.english: Data movement can be accomplished in batch mode, as well as realtime interactive mode.
sentences.chinese: 可以跑批來往成數據的遷移，也可以實時的相互作用。

sentences.english: We hereby inform you that your last shipment has apparently been lost.
sentences.chinese: 上批貨物顯然已經丟失，特此告知。

definition: to tidy up/to reorganize/to consolidate/to rectify
official written ruling in response to a submission/official approval in writing
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
to report for duty/to check in/to register
to arrange/to line up/file/series/(in data tables) column/(Tw) row
to issue (a memorandum etc) to lower levels/to distribute (e.g. disaster relief to victims)
to issue/to proclaim/to enact (laws, decrees etc)
